text:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-bmoeller-tls-falsestart-00 describes a new extension for reducing the overall roundtrip count in the TLS handshake by one.

Chrome 9+ has support for it and has seen a 30% improvement in latency. Firefox has a ticket but is yet to prioritize it (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=658222).

Supporting False Start from the server side will reduce the roundtrip count by one during abridged TLS handshakes.

Does this involve waiting for Java's SSL implementation to add support for this kind of handshake modification as well?
creator: shashank.shekhar.global@gmail.com

text: Tomcat does not implement SSL, it uses the JSSE implementation from the JVM and/or OpenSSL. Once those implementations support this, Tomcat will use them automatically.
creator: markt@apache.org
shashank.shekhar.global@gmail.com
text: Thanks for the clarification. I had a hunch, but it's good to see it getting answered authoritatively.
